org.pepstock.charba.client

Class ChartObserver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pepstock.charba.client.ChartObserver

  • final class ChartObserver
extends Object
    Internal singleton utility which provides the ability to watch for attach and detach changes being made to the DOM tree for a chart instance.
    Author:
    Andrea "Stock" Stocchero

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Map<String,MutationHandler> handlers 
      private static ChartObserver INSTANCE 

    • Constructor Summary

      Modifier Constructor and Description
      private ChartObserver()
      TO avoid any instantiation

      (package private) void addHandler(MutationHandler handler)
      Adds a mutation handler to notify when a chart will be attached or detached.
      private void checkAndPerformAttachement(BaseElement element, boolean attach)
      Checks if the element is related to a chart instance and if true, notify the chart of the attach or detach.

      Returns the singleton instance of observer.

      • get

        static ChartObserver get()
        Returns the singleton instance of observer.
        Returns:
        the singleton instance of observer

      • addHandler

        void addHandler(MutationHandler handler)
        Adds a mutation handler to notify when a chart will be attached or detached.
        Parameters:
        handler - handler instance to store

      • removeHandler

        void removeHandler(MutationHandler handler)
        Removes a mutation handler from notification list.
        Parameters:
        handler - handler instance to store

      • scanAndCheckElements

        private void scanAndCheckElements(List<BaseHtmlElement> elements,
                                  boolean attach)
        Scans all elements to get which elements are attached or detached.
        Parameters:
        elements - list of elements affected by attach or detach
        attach - if true, checks for attached elements otherwise for detached ones

      • scanAndCheckElements

        private void scanAndCheckElements(BaseElement parent,
                                  boolean attach)
        Scans recursively the DOM tree to get which elements are attached or detached.
        Parameters:
        parent - parent element to scan
        attach - if true, checks for attached elements otherwise for detached ones

      • checkAndPerformAttachement

        private void checkAndPerformAttachement(BaseElement element,
                                        boolean attach)
        Checks if the element is related to a chart instance and if true, notify the chart of the attach or detach.
        Parameters:
        element - element to check if is related to a chart
        attach - if true, checks for attached elements otherwise for detached ones

      • isChartElementAttached

        private boolean isChartElementAttached(String elementId)
        Returns true if the elements related to a chart has been attached.
        Parameters:
        elementId - element id which should be the same of chart id
        Returns:
        true if the elements related to a chart has been attached

      • isChartElementDetached

        private boolean isChartElementDetached(String elementId)
        Returns true if the elements related to a chart has been detached.
        Parameters:
        elementId - element id which should be the same of chart id
        Returns:
        true if the elements related to a chart has been detached
